page.title: 04The School(2)
page.content: The present school serves the villages of Honington, and Troston, plus a substantial intake from the RAF base just a mile-and-a-half from the main village; a school population of approximately 130 children, with the inevitable high mobility of service children. At one time the school boasted some 300 children, before the RAF spread their personnel over a wider catchment area and the present climate of falling rolls. At that time two classes were educated in an annexe near to the RAF base whilst temporary 'caravans' were in use in the school grounds. One of these remains in use,whilst use of the annexe ceased in 1976.
